definition: to agree/to go along with/to echo (what sb says)
to add/to attach/to be close to/to be attached
and/together with/with/sum/union/peace/harmony/Taiwan pr. [han4] when it means "and" or "with"
surname He/Japanese (food, clothes etc)
to combine a powdery substance (flour, plaster etc) with water/Taiwan pr. [huo4]
to complete a set in mahjong or playing cards
to compose a poem in reply (to sb's poem) using the same rhyme sequence/to join in the singing/to chime in with others
to mix (ingredients) together/to blend/classifier for rinses of clothes/classifier for boilings of medicinal herbs
to parrot other people's words (idiom); to chime in with others

sentences.english: Or use whole-wheat flour and sprinkle wheat germ on your food.
sentences.chinese: 或者食用全麥食物和附和喫些小麥胚芽。

sentences.english: Laugh and the world laughs with you , weep, and you weep alone .
sentences.chinese: 笑時萬衆附和，哭時獨自垂淚。

sentences.english: But where I object is when the games that sate them become greater in number than those for the more discerning player.
sentences.chinese: 但是我抗議的是，附和他們品位的遊戲的數量過多。

sentences.english: You toss in a few nods and yeses at the right moments, you hope.
sentences.chinese: 還期望自己在恰當的時刻能夠點頭附和。

sentences.english: It is most understandable, " offered Spring Moon politely."
sentences.chinese: “這是可以理解的，”春月客氣地附和着。

sentences.english: "Let's forget about it and move on to the good stuff, " more voices echoed in agreement.
sentences.chinese: 甭管它，來拍賣好東西吧，“更多的聲音應聲附和道。

sentences.english: "Little better than a beggar, " said the Town Councillors.
sentences.chinese: “的確比要飯的強不了多少，”市參議員們附和着說。

sentences.english: What he says is ridiculous, yet many people echo his words.
sentences.chinese: 他的講話真荒唐，但有很多人隨聲附和。

sentences.english: They echoed every word of their leader.
sentences.chinese: 他們隨聲附和他們領導人的每句話。

sentences.english: Because Arnold is a yes-man. He agrees with everything the boss says!
sentences.chinese: 因爲他是個應聲蟲，老闆說的話他都附和。

sentences.english: He echoed every word of his superior.
sentences.chinese: 隨聲附和他上級的每一句話。

sentences.english: “Yeah, the same, ” Matthew echoed, a dim grin on his face.
sentences.chinese: “是啊，一樣，”馬修隨聲附和，臉上笑意隱約。

sentences.english: Only my voice took up the tunes, and my heart danced in their cadence.
sentences.chinese: 我只隨聲附和，我的心應節跳舞。

sentences.english: Many of the Greek and Roman historians subscribed to Model B.
sentences.chinese: 許多希臘戰羅馬的歷試蔡家附和模子B。

sentences.english: At these instances, I laughed along with the people, and those were the moments the tavern keeper never scolded me for laughing.
sentences.chinese: 在這些時候，我可以附和着笑，掌櫃是決不責備的。

definition: to parrot other people's words (idiom); to chime in with others
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
to second a motion
to echo one another/to respond (in agreement)
to interrupt (sb speaking)/interruption/digression
to heckle/rowdy jeering/to create a disturbance
to interrupt (sb talking)/to butt in/to cut into a conversation
to shout/to bellow one's grievances
to approve of/to endorse/(vote) in favor
to retort/to refute
to laugh heartily/to burst into loud laughter
to roar with laughter/hoots of laughter/guffaw
to fawn on/to flatter/to ingratiate oneself/flattery
to speak/words
to comply in order to please others/to accommodate sb else's taste/to make fun of
to praise/to speak highly of/compliment/praise
